links.title: Haversine formula - Wikipedia
links.description: The haversine formula determines the great-circle distance between two points on a sphere given their longitudes and latitudes. links.title: LRB · Andrew O’Hagan · Ghosting: Julian Assange
links.description: On 5 January 2011, at 8.30 p.m., I was messing about at home when the phone buzzed on the sofa. It was a text from Jamie Byng, the publisher of Canongate. ‘Are you about?’ it said. ‘I have a somewhat left-field idea. It’s potentially very exciting. But I need to discuss urgently.’ . . .

links.title: The U.S. Government’s Indictment of Julian Assange Poses Grave Threats to Press Freedom

links.title: Kevin Poulsen on Twitter
links.description:
“Here's Julian Assange's fateful offer to crack a password for Chelsea Manning.

Context: Manning, worried her SIPRnet downloads were being noticed, thought about using someone else's desktop for a while to cover tracks.”

links.title: Jake Williams on Twitter
links.description: “@kpoulsen But he did "send it to our LM guy" - I seriously think that he crossed the line here from journalism to material support. Whether or not he passed the hash (sorry) to his "LM guy" or not, he was clearly offering support for what he knew were illegal activities. 1/2”

links.title: Julian Assange is an activist, not a journalist
links.description: Frida Ghitis writes that Julian Assange's claim that he is a journalist is false, but that will not preclude authoritarian goverments from using his case to thwart the legitimate media.

links.title: Document: Julian Assange Indictment
links.description: On Thursday, the U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of Virginia unsealed a March 6, 2018 indictment charging Julian Assange, the founder head of WikiLeaks, for conspiring to commit computer intrusions by assisting Chelsea Manning with breaking a U.S. government password. The grand jury charged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§371, 1030(a)(1), 1030(a)(2) and 1030(c)(2)(B)(ii).

links.title: Chelsea Manning to Be Released Early as Obama Commutes Sentence
links.description: The Army intelligence analyst convicted in a 2010 leak of security documents is set to be freed this May instead of in 2045.

links.title: Julian Assange: journalistic hero or enemy agent?

links.title: Japan's working population drops further
links.description: Japan's working population shrank further last year with its ratio to overall population dropping to a record low, while the pace of increase in the number of foreigners accelerated, government data showed Friday. The annual data from the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications reflect the country's deepening labor crunch,…

links.title: Table 7. Persons Obtaining Lawful Permanent Resident Status by Type and Detailed Class of Admission: Fiscal Year 2017
links.description: The 2017 Yearbook of Immigration Statistics is a compendium of tables that provide data on foreign nationals who are granted lawful permanent residence (i.e., immigrants who receive a “green card”), admitted as temporary nonimmigrants, granted asylum or refugee status, or are naturalized. The Yearbook also presents data on immigration enforcement actions, including apprehensions and arrests, removals, and returns.

links.description: Fertility rate measures the average number of children per woman. In recent decades the global fertility rate has halved. But how does children per woman vary across the world? Which countries have the most and least children? See global and country-level data.
